results.title: Presenting Standard Triumph
results.brief_description: Survey of the Standard-Triumph motor car works, Describes the design, construction, assembly and testing of current range of automobiles. Advanced automation is used in the workshops including a Leo computer. Shows contribution of research teams to the development and design of new models.

results.title: Presenting South Australia. No. 4
results.creator_credit: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau and Geoffrey Shepherd
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Art in the open: a survey of the Open Air Art Exhibitions held annually in various parks around Adelaide. Historic residence in the hills: eight miles from Adelaide at the Bellair National Park is the Old Government House. Down at the wharf: a boy spends a pleasant Sunday afternoon at Port Adelaide.

results.title: Presenting a career in retailing
results.brief_description: Describe the general conditions and points out the advantages of a career in retail selling. Sales and office staff are shown at work in various stores and the promotion system for salesmen and salesgirls is explained.

results.title: Presentation techniques
results.brief_description: Provides materal suitable for assisting teachers to develop the skills they need in the presentation of Direct Instruction Materials. Notes scripts and formats, signals and group responses, how to present a lesson, how to practice on one’s own, how to use sample lessons and the importance of corrections. No other credits available

results.title: Prescription for two: an oldtime comedy
results.brief_description: An oldtime silent comedy. A continually arguing couple are told separately by medical friends that the other has a heart complaint and must be treated with care. This works for a short time until they both discover the ruse. However, they then both really do believe that they each have a heart complaint and call another doctor for his advice. His solution is to give them a prescription for two for living happily together. No credits.

results.title: Preschool social development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses developments such as emergence of a sense of morality, need for approval, gender identity, emotional regulation. Importance of adequate attachment experiences is stressed.
